item.title: Crew Rest Area Air Supply System

numlitem.para: Air supply valve remains in the closed position, and
If CRA is occupied, entrance door and occupied bunk's privacy curtains must remain open.
Crew Rest Area (CRA) entry door and privacy curtains must remain open during flight.
Ensure that the CREW REST RESET switch is not depressed. To do so may cause the air supply valve to open.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Crew rest area entry "CRA AIR SUPPLY_INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard Crew Rest Reset Switch on the supernumerary attendant panel "DO NOT PRESS RESET SWITCH".

maintenance.para: Deactivate Crew Rest Area (CRA) air supply valve closed:

numlitem.para: Press Self Test Button on any CRA smoke detector (detector's alarm horn will sound).
Observe that Air Supply CREW REST RESET switch on the supernumerary attendant panel is illuminated indicating air supply valve (Crew Rest Shutoff Valve V553) is closed.
For valve not closed, gain access to valve and manually position valve closed (AMM 21-29-02/402).
On ECS Maintenance page, verify CRA Trim Mod Valve is also in a closed position.
Open and collar P6 panel U/D CR MOD VLV circuit breaker.
